intro: Senecio lygodes, commonly known as the yellow starburster, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Senecio lygodes is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
